p: Plant physiology has been greatly influenced by climate variability by several means. Environmental extremes and climate variability enhanced the chances of numerous stresses on plants [ 23]. Climate change affects crop production by means of direct, indirect, and socio-economic effects as described in Figure 1. Furthermore, climate change (drought, flood, high temperature, storm etc.) events are increased dramatically as reported by Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) and as shown in Figure 2.
